SENT.plain: Patients with the Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome have numerous anomalies, varying somewhat from case to case
The most common presentation is exomphalos, macroglossia, and somatic gigantism
Although cleft palate in association with this syndrome has been rarely reported, we have observed 6 patients with cleft palate in 10 patients who were diagnosed with the Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome
The literature is reviewed and discussed
